androidx.fragment.app

Class FragmentTabHost

  • java.lang.Object
    • TabHost
      • androidx.fragment.app.FragmentTabHost

  • public class FragmentTabHost
extends TabHost
    Special TabHost that allows the use of Fragment objects for its tab content. When placing this in a view hierarchy, after inflating the hierarchy you must call setup(Context, FragmentManager, int) to complete the initialization of the tab host.

    Here is a simple example of using a FragmentTabHost in an Activity:

    This can also be used inside of a fragment through fragment nesting:

Generated javadoc for the new package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK. Going forward, the android.* package hierarchy will be reserved for Android packages that ship with the operating system; other packages will be issued in the new androidx.* package hiearchy.
